gurmukhi: irp jIq AjIq ABIq bfy AvnI pY sBY jsu gwvhgy ] Bl Bwg BXw ieh sMBl ky hirjU hirmMdr Awvhgy ]144]
transliteration: Rip Jeet Abheet Bade Avnipai Sabhai Jas(u) Gadvahge|| Bhal Bhaag Bhayaa Eh Sanbhal Ke Har(i)joo Har(i)mandar Aavahge||144||
translation: He will conquer the great enemies, all will eulogise him on the earth; the town of Sambhal is very fortunate, where the Lord will manifest Himself.144.

gurmukhi: SyS suryS mhyS gnyS inSyS Bly jsu gwvhgy ] gx BUq pryq ipswc prI jX s`d nn`d sunwvhgy ]
transliteration: Shesh Suresh Mahesh Gadesh Nishesh Bhale Jas(u) Gadvahge|| Gad Bhoot Daret Pisaach Parijaya Sadd Nanadd Sounaavahge||
translation: Sheshnaga, Indra, Shiva, Ganesha, Chandra, all of them will eulogise Him; the ganas, the ghosts, fiends, imps and fairies, all of them will hail Him;

gurmukhi: nr nwrd quMbr ikMnr j`C su bIn pRbIn bjwvhgy ] Bl Bwg BXw ieh sMBl ky hirjU hirmMdr Awvhgy ]145]
transliteration: Nar Naarad Tounbar Kinnar Jachchh Su Been Prabeen Bajaavahge|| Bhal Bhaag Bhayaa Eh Sanbhal Ke Har(i)joo Har(i)mandar Aavahge||145||
translation: Nara, Narada, Kinnars, Yakshas etc. will play on their lyres in order to welcome him; the town of Sambhal is very fortunate, where the Lord will manifest Himself.145.

gurmukhi: qwl miRdMg mucMg aupMg surMg sy nwd sunwvhgy ] fP bwr qrMg rbwb qurI rx sMK AsMK bjvhgy ]
transliteration: Taal Mridan Mouchannd Oupan Suran Se Naad Sounaavahge|| Daph Baar Taran Rabaab Turiran Sankh Asankh Bajaavahge||
translation: The sounds of drums will be heard; the tabors, the musical glasses, rababs and conches etc. will be played,

gurmukhi: rx duMDB Foln Gor GnI sun S`qR sBY murCwvhgy ] Bl Bwg BXw ieh sMBl ky hirjU hirmMdr Awvhgy ]146]
transliteration: Tan Doundhabh Dholan Ghor Ghanisoun Shattra Sabhai Murchhaadahge|| Bhal Bhaag Bhayaa Eh Sanbhal Ke Har(i)joo Har(i)mandar Aavahge||146||
translation: And hearing the sounds of large and small, the enemies will become unconscious; the town of Sambhal is very fortunate, where the Lord will manifest Himself.146.

gurmukhi: qIr quPMg kmwn surMg durMg inKMg suhwvhgy ] brCI Aru bYrK bwn Dujw pt bwq lgy Phrwvhgy ]
transliteration: Tir Touphankamaan Suran Duran Nikhanndsuhaavahge|| Barchhiar(u) Bairakh Baan Dbujaa Pat Baat Lage Phahraavahge||
translation: He will look splendid with bow, arrows, quiver etc; he will hold the lance and spear and his banners will wave;

gurmukhi: gx j`C BujMg su ikMnr is`D pRis`D sBY jsu gwvhgy ] Bl Bwg BXw ieh sMBl ky hirjU hirmMdr Awvhgy ]147]
transliteration: Gad Jachchh Bhujan Su Kinnar Siddh Prasiddh Sabhi Jas(u) Gadvahge|| Bhal Bhaag Bhayaa Eh Sanbhal Ke Har(i)joo Har(i)mandar Aavahge||147||
translation: The Ganas, Yakshas, Nagas, Kinnars and all famous adepts will eulogise Hiim; the town of Sambhal is very fortunate, where the Lord will manifest Himself.147.

gurmukhi: kauc kiRpwn ktwrI kmwn su rMg inKMg Ckwvhgy ] brCI Aru Fwl gdw prso kr sUl qiRsUl BRmwvhgy ]
transliteration: Kaouch Kridaan Kataari Kamaan Su Ran Nikhanndchhakaavahge|| Barchhi Ar(u) Dhaal Gadaa Parso Kar Sool Trisool Bhramaavahge||
translation: He will kill in very great numbers using his sword, dagger, bow, quiver and armour; he will strike blows with his lance, mace, axe, spear, trident etc. and use his shield;

gurmukhi: Aiq kRu`Dq h√çY rx mUrDn mo sr EG pREG clwvhgy ] Bl Bwg BXw ieh sMBl ky hirjU hirmMdr Awvhgy ]148]
transliteration: At(i) Kruddhat Hvai Ran Moonddhan Mo Sar Ogh Praogh Chalaavahge|| Bhal Bhaag Bhayaa Eh Sanbhal Ke Har(i)joo Har(i)mandar Aavahge||148||
translation: In His fury, He will shower arrows in the war; the town of Sambhal is very fortunate, where the Lord will manifest Himself.148.

gurmukhi: qyj pRcMf AKMf mhwN Cb du`jn dyK prwvhgy ] ijm paun pRcMf bhY pqUAw sB Awpn hI auif jwvhgy ]
transliteration: Tej Prachanndd Akhannddmahaan Chhab Dujjan Dekh Paraavahge|| Jim Paoun Prachanndd Bahai Patooaa Sabh Aapan Hiud(i) Jaavahge||
translation: Seeing his powerful beauty and glory, the tyrants will flee like the leaves flying before the strong gust of wind;

gurmukhi: biF hY ijq hI iqq Drm dSw khUM pwp n FUMFq pwvhgy ] Bl Bwg BXw ieh sMBl ky hirjU hirmMdr Awvhgy ]149]
transliteration: Badh(i) Hai Jit Hitit Dharam Dashaa Kahoon Paap Na Dhoondhat Paavahge|| Bhal Bhaag Bhayaa Eh Sanbhal Ke Har(i)joo Har(i)mandar Aavahge||149||
translation: Wherever He will go, the dharma will increase and the sin will not be seen even on seeking; the town of Sambhal is very fortunate, where the Lord will manifest Himself.149.

gurmukhi: CUtq bwn kmwnin ky rx Cwif Btvw Bhrwvhgy ] rxbIr ibqwl krwl pRBw rx mUrDn m`iD suhwvhgy ]
transliteration: Chhodhtat Baan Kamaanan(i) Ke Ran Chhnd(i) Bhatvaa Bhahraavahge|| Ranbeer Bidaal Karaal Prabhaa Ran Moonddhan Maddh(i) Suhaavahge||
translation: With the discharge of the arrows from His bow, the warriors will fall down is perplexity and there will be many powerful spirits and dreadful ghosts;

gurmukhi: gix is`D pRis`D smiR`D snY kir aucwie kY kiRq sunwvhgy ] Bl Bwg BXw ieh sMBl ky hirjU hirmMdr Awvhgy ]150]
transliteration: Gad(i) Siddh Prasiddh Samriddh Sanai Kar(i) Ouchaae Kai Krit Sounaavahge|| Bhal Bhaag Bhayn Eh Sanbhal Ke Har(i)joo Har(i)mandar Aavahge||150||
translation: The famous ganas and adepts will eulogise Him by repeatedly raising their hands; the town of Sambhal is very fortunate where the Lord will manifest Himself.150.

gurmukhi: rUp AnUp srUp mhwN AMg dyK AnMg Ajwvhgy ] Bv BUq Biv`K Bvwn sdw sB Taur sBY Thrwvhgy ]
transliteration: Roop Anoop Saroop Mahaan An Dekh Anang Lajaavahge|| Bhav Bhoot Bhavikkh Bhavaan Sadaa Sabh Thaur Sabhai Thahraavahge||
translation: Seeing his charming form and limbs, the god of love will feel shy and the past, present and future, seeing Him, will stay at their place;
